dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 22 × 14.3 cm (8 11/16 × 5 5/8 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector stamp in blue ink, verso lower right: Comte A. B. Lobanoff-Rostovsky (Lugt 2005)

Collector stamp in brown ink, verso center: A.F. von Lanna (Lugt 2773)

Inscribed in graphite, verso centeer: ....Leipzig...
inscribed:
Signed and dated in plate, lower left: Lower left: Henricus / Goltzius fecit / 1582

Seven lines in Latin by Janus Dousa in margin below print, lower center: In aere, Lector, ... Gallionis ora Goltzio.

makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Alexandre Borisovitch Lobanoff-Rostovsky [?-ca.1880, Lugt 2005], sale of his collection, Berlin, April 26, 1881, lot 326; Adalbert von Lanna [1836-1909, Lugt 2773]; sale of his collection, Stuttgart, May 11-22, 1909, lot 1799; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
